metadata.title: CVE-2012-1586 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
mount.cifs in cifs-utils 2.6 allows local users to determine the existenceof arbitrary files or directories via the file path in the second argument,which reveals their existence in an error message.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-1586` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cifs-utils - 2:6.0-1ubuntu2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: cifs-utils package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:6.0-1ubuntu2').
